item.title: VCs deploy ‘kingmaking’ strategy to crown AI winners in their infancy
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: While VCs have long used big investments to spur category winners, they are taking this strategy to new extremes.

item.title: Company backed by Donald Trump Jr.’s firm nabs $620M government contract
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Vulcan Elements, a rare-earth magnets startup, has secured a $620 million contract from the U.S. defense department.

item.title: This VC charges $0 for PR, and has 12 unicorns to show for it
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Tech is racing ahead while society struggles to keep up. Masha Bucher, founder and GP of Day One Ventures, built her firm around closing that gap by combining venture capital with hands-on PR to help portfolio companies not just raise money, but actually break through the noise.   Day One’s been an early backer of companies […]

item.title: Tonight, the future of deep tech will be explained to you at StrictlyVC Palo Alto
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: On Wednesday evening at Playground Global in Palo Alto, some very smart people who are building things you don't understand yet will explain what's coming. This is the final StrictlyVC event of 2025, and truly, the lineup is ridiculous.

item.title: Kalshi raises $1B at $11B valuation, doubling value in under two months
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The latest funding comes less than two months after Kalshi announced that it raised $300 million at a $5 billion valuation.

item.title: Simular’s AI agent wants to run your Mac, Windows PC for you
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Simular, a startup building AI agents for Mac OS and Windows, has solved the AI hallucination problem in a compelling way.

item.title: Paris-based AI voice startup Gradium nabs $70M seed
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Gradium, a startup spawned out of French AI lab Kyutai (backed by French telecom billionaire Xavier Niel), launched out of stealth on Tuesday.

item.title: How AI PR startup Clipbook won Mark Cuban’s investment from a cold email
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Adam Joseph was shocked when Mark Cuban replied to his email with an inquisition full of questions.

item.title: At least 80 new tech unicorns were minted in 2025 so far
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Using data from Crunchbase and PitchBook, TechCrunch tracked down the VC-backed startups that became unicorns so far this year.

item.title: ChatGPT launched three years ago today
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: It’s no hyperbole to suggest that ChatGPT subsequently transformed the worlds of business and tech.

item.title: Behind the scenes of drone food delivery in Finland
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: TechCrunch went behind the scenes of a three-party partnership between Irish drone delivery company Manna, DoorDash-owned food delivery platform Wolt, and food startup Huuva.

item.title: Supabase hit $5B by turning down million-dollar contracts. Here’s why.
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Vibe coding has taken the tech industry by storm, and it’s not just the Lovables and Replits of the world that are winning. The startups building the infrastructure behind them are cashing in too.  Supabase, the open source database platform that’s become the back end of choice for the vibe-coding world, raised $100 million at […]

item.title: Supabase CEO on the ‘painful’ decisions that built a $5B company
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Julie Bort
item.description: Vibe coding has taken the tech industry by storm, and it’s not just the Lovables and Replits of the world that are winning. The startups building the infrastructure behind them are cashing in too.  Supabase, the open source database platform that’s become the back end of choice for the vibe-coding world, raised $100 million at a $5 billion valuation just months after […]

item.title: SoftBank stays in as Meesho $606M IPO becomes India’s first major e-commerce listing
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Meesho, an Indian e-commerce rival to Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart, is set to launch a roughly $606 million IPO marked by token sell-downs from early backers and no sales from big names such as SoftBank and Prosus, signaling investor conviction in India's booming online retail market at a time when tech shareholders globally have been cashing out at listings.

item.title: How OpenAI and Google see AI changing go-to-market strategies
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: AI is changing how investors and startups bring their products to market. Three experts offered their insights at TechCrunch Disrupt.

item.title: Glīd won Startup Battlefield 2025 by building solutions to make logistics simpler, safer, and smarter
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: We're excited to interview the winner of Startup Battlefield 2025, and Glid co-founder Kevin Damoa, on this week's Build Mode!

item.title: From military logistics to Startup Battlefield 2025 champion with Glīd founder, Kevin Damoa
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Glīd CEO and founder Kevin Damoa shares what it takes to win Startup Battlefield 2025 and build a company solving real infrastructure problems. Fresh off his victory, De reveals how a veteran’s perspective on logistics led to an autonomous solution bridging congested roads and underutilized rail. Plus, he shares how mindfulness, mission-driven culture, and $70M in early customer commitments positioned Glīd for success. New episodes of Build […]

item.title: Nordic founders are taking bigger swings, and it’s paying off
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Ten years ago, raising €1 million in Copenhagen was enough to make waves in the region’s tech scene. Today, the Nordics are turning out billion-dollar companies like Lovable — which hit $200 million in revenue just 12 months after launching. Dennis Green-Lieber, founder of AI-powered customer intelligence platform Propane, has had a front-row seat to that shift […]

item.title: Here are the 49 US AI startups that have raised $100M or more in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Last year was monumental for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. How will 2025 compare?

item.title: JustiGuide wants to use AI to help people navigate the US immigration system
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The startup uses AI to help immigrants understand the system, connect with lawyers, and reduce associated costs.
